verses.kjv: Samuel also said unto Saul, The LORD sent me to anoint thee to be king over his people, over Israel: now therefore hearken thou unto the voice of the words of the LORD.
verses.ct: Samuel said to Saul, "The LORD sent me to anoint you as king over his people Israel. So now, listen carefully to the LORD's message."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I remember that which Amalek did to Israel, how he laid wait for him in the way, when he came up from Egypt.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD of Hosts says: 'I have not forgotten what the Amalekites did to Israel — how they ambushed them along the road when they were coming up from Egypt."

verses.kjv: Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.
verses.ct: "Now go and attack the Amalekites. Completely destroy everything they have. Show no mercy. Kill every man and woman, every child and infant, every ox and sheep, every camel and donkey.'"

verses.kjv: And Saul gathered the people together, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.
verses.ct: Saul assembled his troops and counted them at Telaim — 200,000 foot soldiers plus 10,000 men from Judah.

verses.kjv: And Saul came to a city of Amalek, and laid wait in the valley.
verses.ct: Saul advanced to an Amalekite city and set up an ambush in the valley.

verses.kjv: And Saul said unto the Kenites, Go, depart, get you down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them: for ye shewed kindness to all the children of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt. So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.
verses.ct: Saul sent word to the Kenites: "Leave now! Get away from the Amalekites so I don't destroy you along with them. You showed kindness to all the Israelites when they came out of Egypt." So the Kenites moved away from the Amalekites.

verses.kjv: And Saul smote the Amalekites from Havilah until thou comest to Shur, that is over against Egypt.
verses.ct: Saul defeated the Amalekites across the whole region from Havilah all the way to Shur, east of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: He captured Agag, the king of the Amalekites, alive, but killed all the rest of the people with the sword.

verses.kjv: But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, and of the fatlings, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them: but every thing that was vile and refuse, that they destroyed utterly.
verses.ct: However, Saul and his troops spared Agag, along with the best sheep, cattle, fattened calves, lambs, and everything else of value. They refused to completely destroy those things. They only destroyed what was worthless and unwanted.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD unto Samuel, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Samuel:

verses.kjv: It repenteth me that I have set up Saul to be king: for he is turned back from following me, and hath not performed my commandments. And it grieved Samuel; and he cried unto the LORD all night.
verses.ct: "I regret that I made Saul king, because he has turned away from me and has not carried out my commands." This deeply troubled Samuel, and he cried out to the LORD all through the night.

verses.kjv: And when Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning, it was told Samuel, saying, Saul came to Carmel, and, behold, he set him up a place, and is gone about, and passed on, and gone down to Gilgal.
verses.ct: Samuel got up early the next morning to meet Saul, but someone told him, "Saul went to Carmel, where he set up a monument for himself. Then he moved on and went down to Gilgal."

verses.kjv: And Samuel came to Saul: and Saul said unto him, Blessed be thou of the LORD: I have performed the commandment of the LORD.
verses.ct: When Samuel reached him, Saul greeted him, "May the LORD bless you! I have carried out the LORD's command."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?
verses.ct: But Samuel replied, "Then what is this bleating of sheep that I hear? And what is this sound of cattle?"

verses.kjv: And Saul said, They have brought them from the Amalekites: for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.
verses.ct: Saul answered, "The soldiers brought them back from the Amalekites. They kept the best of the sheep and cattle to offer as sacrifices to the LORD your God. But everything else we completely destroyed."

verses.kjv: Then Samuel said unto Saul, Stay, and I will tell thee what the LORD hath said to me this night. And he said unto him, Say on.
verses.ct: Samuel said to Saul, "Stop! Let me tell you what the LORD said to me last night." Saul replied, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, When thou wast little in thine own sight, wast thou not made the head of the tribes of Israel, and the LORD anointed thee king over Israel?
verses.ct: Samuel said, "Even though you once considered yourself insignificant, weren't you appointed as the leader of all the tribes of Israel? The LORD anointed you king over Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD sent thee on a journey, and said, Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed.
verses.ct: The LORD sent you on a mission and told you, 'Go and completely destroy those sinners, the Amalekites. Fight against them until they are wiped out.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore then didst thou not obey the voice of the LORD, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst evil in the sight of the LORD?
verses.ct: So why didn't you obey the LORD? Why did you rush to grab the plunder and do what is evil in the LORD's sight?"

verses.kjv: And Saul said unto Samuel, Yea, I have obeyed the voice of the LORD, and have gone the way which the LORD sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
verses.ct: Saul protested, "But I did obey the LORD! I went on the mission the LORD gave me. I brought back Agag, the king of Amalek, and I completely destroyed the Amalekites.

verses.kjv: But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the things which should have been utterly destroyed, to sacrifice unto the LORD thy God in Gilgal.
verses.ct: The soldiers took sheep and cattle from the plunder — the best of what was supposed to be destroyed — to sacrifice to the LORD your God at Gilgal."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, Hath the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.
verses.ct: Samuel responded, "Does the LORD take as much pleasure in burnt offerings and sacrifices as he does in obedience to his commands? Pay attention: obedience is more valuable than sacrifice, and listening to God matters more than the fat of rams.

verses.kjv: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry. Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, he hath also rejected thee from being king.
verses.ct: Rebellion is just as sinful as witchcraft, and stubbornness is no different from wickedness and idolatry. Because you have rejected the LORD's command, he has rejected you as king."

verses.kjv: And Saul said unto Samuel, I have sinned: for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD, and thy words: because I feared the people, and obeyed their voice.
verses.ct: Saul admitted to Samuel, "I have sinned. I violated the LORD's command and your instructions because I was afraid of the people and gave in to their demands.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship the LORD.
verses.ct: Please forgive my sin and come back with me so that I can worship the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said unto Saul, I will not return with thee: for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.
verses.ct: But Samuel told Saul, "I will not go back with you. You rejected the LORD's command, and the LORD has rejected you as king over Israel."

verses.kjv: And as Samuel turned about to go away, he laid hold upon the skirt of his mantle, and it rent.
verses.ct: As Samuel turned to walk away, Saul grabbed the edge of his robe, and it tore.

verses.kjv: And Samuel said unto him, The LORD hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbour of thine, that is better than thou.
verses.ct: Samuel said to him, "The LORD has torn the kingdom of Israel away from you today and has given it to someone better than you.

verses.kjv: And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.
verses.ct: The Eternal One of Israel does not lie or change his mind, because he is not a human being who changes his mind."

verses.kjv: Then he said, I have sinned: yet honour me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and turn again with me, that I may worship the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: Saul pleaded, "I have sinned. But please, honor me in front of the elders of my people and in front of Israel. Come back with me so I can worship the LORD your God."

verses.kjv: So Samuel turned again after Saul; and Saul worshipped the LORD.
verses.ct: So Samuel went back with Saul, and Saul worshiped the LORD.

verses.kjv: Then said Samuel, Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites. And Agag came unto him delicately. And Agag said, Surely the bitterness of death is past.
verses.ct: Then Samuel ordered, "Bring Agag, the king of the Amalekites, to me." Agag approached him confidently, thinking, "Surely the threat of death has passed."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, As thy sword hath made women childless, so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.
verses.ct: But Samuel declared, "Just as your sword has left women without their children, so your mother will be left without her child." Then Samuel cut Agag to pieces in the presence of the LORD at Gilgal.

verses.kjv: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.
verses.ct: After that, Samuel left for Ramah, and Saul went home to Gibeah of Saul.

verses.kjv: And Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death: nevertheless Samuel mourned for Saul: and the LORD repented that he had made Saul king over Israel.
verses.ct: Samuel never went to see Saul again for the rest of his life, but he grieved over Saul. And the LORD regretted that he had made Saul king over Israel.
